10:32 <vmassol> going to take a memory dump of xwiki.org which will be unavailable for 10 mns  
10:32 <vmassol> anyone has an issue with this?  
10:34 <vmassol> doing it in 1mn  
10:36 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:45 <Kaisen> Hello, maybe it is related to my lack of knowledge but I face some troubles regarding the change of attachment from database to file system.  
10:45 <Kaisen> As soon you have a virgin wiki (with standard installation) some icon pictures are missing after changing the attachment store settings which are mentioned.  
10:45 <Kaisen> I'm not sure if I'm able to added things as soon as I'm registered. So I hope that here is the right way to communicate.  
10:45 <xwikibot> has quit  
10:46 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
10:46 <cjd> ok probably the .zip which would explain the annoying matter of having to convert attachments at the beginning  
10:46 <vmassol> maybe you're using the zip distribution which has a set of default pages  
10:46 <camil7> unless one starts with the "zip" package, which is actually what a lot of people are doing ...  
10:47 <cjd> maybe we should build a .zip with FS attach enabled by default  
10:47 <vmassol> cjd: no, I'd prefer that we make FS the default for attachments ;)  
10:48 <cjd> do one and then the other?  
10:48 <vmassol> if they're the defaujlt  
10:48 <vmassol> then the zip will have the atatchments on FS  
10:48 <vmassol> ;)  
10:48 <vmassol> s/they're/it's  
10:49 <Kaisen> For me I used the debian install dep and run the "installation wizard" which download the rest and configure the "standard" xwiki  
10:49 <cjd> it's possible, just jumping in immedietly without a sort of staging period could be a source of bugs  
10:49 <vmassol> Kaisen: cool but did you set up FS config before running the DW?  
10:49 <cjd> DW == "installation wizard"  
10:50 <Kaisen> No I run everthing and than I start configuring the xwiki.cfg  
10:50 <vmassol> ok then you didn't start with an empty wik  
10:50 <vmassol> the DW installed all the pages in the DB with attachments alors in DB  
10:50 <Kaisen> Yes that what I tought and named it "Virgin" :)  
10:50 <vmassol> so you're doing a migration in practice  
10:51 <camil7>  I can imagine most people consider going though the distribution wizard as part of completing the installation  .... but then you got the logo as attachment at least of course ...  
10:51 <Kaisen> Yes thats what I figured out. But if you changed the settings of the store and run than the script to port the script faild  
10:51 <vmassol> another option is to have a step before the DW to let users configure their wiki  
10:51 <vmassol> to let them choose a  few options  
10:51 <vmassol> DB connnection, FS attachments, etc  
10:52 <cjd> that seems logical  
10:52 <vmassol> an install wizard  
10:52 <vmassol> which is triggered only once  
10:52 <cjd> then you could install a jetty package and point it to mysql  
10:52 <vmassol> and which comes before the Distribution Wizard  
10:52 <cjd> depending on how it worked  
10:53 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-1761  
10:53 <tmortagne> vmassol: but for that tomcat (or whatever) must have the right to modify xwiki.cfg/xwiki.properties/hibernate.cfg.xml  
10:53 <tmortagne> this is the main issue  
10:53 <vmassol> tmortagne: sure, but that works  
10:54 <vmassol> we do write in the permanent dir  
10:54 <cjd> otoh if someone's using tomcat then they're used to bugs :)  
10:54 <tmortagne> vmassol: not note xwiki.cfg  
10:54 <tmortagne> s/note//  
10:54 <vmassol> tmortagne: you mean there's a special security on tomcat by default for WEB-INF?  
10:54 <vmassol> in any case config files must go in the perm dir too  
10:55 <tmortagne> how do you know the perm dir if the configuration is in the perm dir ?  
10:55 <cjd> copy the conf file differences into perm dir?  
10:55 <vmassol> tmortagne: env variable defined by startup script  
10:55 <vmassol> as we do already  
10:55 <cjd> mm that sounds nicer  
10:56 <tmortagne> we do for the jetty/hsqldb becaue we control the start script it's not that easy when we just install xwiki in tomcat  
10:56 <cjd> while we're at it we can port the conf to groovy so it's turing complete xD  
10:56 <vmassol> right now if that env var is not set then we issue a warning and use the temp dir  
10:56 <tmortagne> no it look at the configuration first  
10:56 <vmassol> tmortagne: the user would specify the lcoation  
10:56 <vmassol> on the first screen  
10:57 <vmassol> we need to be able to get to that first screen with no config  
10:57 <vmassol> should be doable  
10:57 <cjd> xwiki.configuration.moreConfiguration=${PERM\_DIR}/xwiki.morecfg  
10:57 <tmortagne> vmassol: and what are we going to do with that location ? find tomcat start script and modify it ?  
10:59 <vmassol> write it in the DB ;)  
10:59 <cjd> haha  
10:59 <vmassol> but that's not really an issue  
10:59 <tmortagne> the DB for which you need the configuration to access ?  
10:59 <vmassol> we can write on the FS too  
10:59 <vmassol> for ex in the user's .xwiki dir  
11:00 <vmassol> or elsewhere  
11:00 <cjd> INSERT INTO db(database\_password) values(...)  
11:00 <cjd> that will work until it doesn't  
11:00 <vmassol> personally I'm fine with a simple approach to start with  
11:01 <vmassol> which is to mandate a system variable  
11:01 <vmassol> we can also fallback on a property located inside WEB-INF/  
11:01 <vmassol> if this var is not defined  
11:02 <cjd> That would solve most of the problems  
11:02 <vmassol> shoudl the admin want to edit that instead  
11:02 <cjd> or perhaps web-inf/xwiki.cfg is authoritative but permdir/xwiki.cfg can extend it  
11:03 <cjd> then we don't have to have those ridiculous password encryption defaults :)  
11:03 <vmassol> cjd: we'll need that for backward compat probably anyway  
11:03 <cjd> just need a comment explaining why some of the config is not seen in the main conf file  
11:04 <tmortagne> I prefer cjd idea bout allowing to extend/overwrite configuration files in permdir than forcing an ENV var  
11:05 <tmortagne> s/bout/about/  
11:06 <cjd> OTOH people who are using ridiculous tomcat/apache stacks probably would not feel worthy if they spent less than a few billable days configuring a system so I'm not completely against a simple ENV variable.  
11:06 <vmassol> we can do all (which is what we alreday do anyway)  
11:06 <vmassol> -Dxwiki.data.dir  
11:07 <vmassol> (used in getPermanentDirectory())  
11:08 <vmassol>             final String[] locations =  
11:08 <vmassol>                 new String[] {systemProperty, classSpecified, configured, getTemporaryDirectoryName(),  
11:08 <cjd> xwikibot: every time you say that you get one step closer to being rewritten in raw jdbc :P  
11:09 <vmassol> the issue is not the bot  
11:09 <vmassol> the issue is xwiki's concurrency AFAIK  
11:09 <cjd> yeah XWHR  
11:09 <cjd> err XWHS  
11:10 <cjd> node.js uses a thread pool in a really interesting way  
11:10 <cjd> it has 6 threads which sit and do nothing until you need to access the filesystem  
11:11 <cjd> then the main thread writes a byte to a pipe which wakes up one of the child threads which grabs a FS access request from a mailbox  
11:11 <cjd> then calls the read()/write()/open()/whatevr  
11:12 <cjd> and then that call goes into the kernel where it calls \_schedule() which usually comes back out in the main thread  
11:12 <cjd> so when you're lucky, all activity happens on one processor core  
11:12 <cjd> and no context switches because it's all the same memory space  
11:14 <Inge-> are you still using Pygments?  
11:15 <cjd> yup  
11:15 <Inge-> did anyone consider Source-highlight?  
11:16 <cjd> written in C?  
11:16 <Inge-> c++, needs the Boost regex library  
11:17 <cjd> mm linking non-java into XWiki is a big can of worms  
11:17 <cjd> pygments runs over jython so it's still java  
11:17 <Inge-> oh well...  
11:18 <Inge-> pygmentize took 5 minutes vs Source-highlight 25 seconds to process 700k+ lines of PostgreSQL source code :)  
11:18 <cjd> yup  
11:18 <cjd> pygments over jvm would take longer  
11:18 <cjd> because jython is not very good  
11:18 <vmassol> what we really do need is a full java solution  
11:18 <vmassol> + some JS solutions (but that's a different use case)  
11:19 <cjd> "full java solution" <-- rm -rf  
11:19 <cjd> :)  
11:19 <cjd> although I have been meaning to play with that toolchain which builds C code into jvm bytecode  
11:20 <cjd> when I get a chance  
11:25 <vmassol> I coded this one too: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Highlight+Macro  
11:25 <vmassol> (had forgotten about ità)  
11:25 <vmassol> JS solution  
11:25 <evalica> has quit  
11:26 <cjd> It seems that the pdf export feature takes more than it's share of resources to maintain because effectively all js solutions are off the table  
11:26 <vmassol> seems it now even has asciidoc and markdown syntaxes  
11:26 <vmassol> it's not just PDF export  
11:26 <vmassol> it's all renderers  
11:27 <tmortagne> it's hard to compete with the number of supported syntaxes Pygments has  
11:27 <vmassol> unless the renderer know how to prcoess a RawBlock of HTML  
11:27 <vmassol> tmortagne: look at http://highlightjs.org/static/test.html it has much more than before  
11:27 <vmassol> no velocity  
11:27 <vmassol> hmm not even groovy actually  
11:28 <tmortagne> I don't see Groovy and velcoity ;)  
11:28 <cjd> well if highlighting doesn't work, it can fail gracefully.. but when people export pdf they expect to see what's in their browser window  
11:29 <camil7> something completely different ... does anyone has a wild guess what might be the problem if XWiki appears to be quite slow if running with an Oracle DB ?  
11:30 <tmortagne> maybe we don't set indexes automatically in Oracle (if indexes even exist in Oracle)  
11:32 <camil7> the hibernate file looks nearly like the same as the one from mysql  
11:32 <camil7> ah, and indexes are there, indeed, so they get created  
12:07 <fmancinelli> has quit  
12:08 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: I have updated the PR  
12:08 <vmassol> thanks  
12:10 <vmassol> "## Assume the argument is an entity reference, so we need to extract the document reference to make a link to it"  
12:10 <vmassol> why wouldn't it be a doc reference?  
12:10 <vmassol> IMO the answer should go in the comment  
12:26 <gdelhumeau> an entity reference might not be a document reference, by definition  
12:30 <vmassol> sure  
12:30 <vmassol> but this doesn't mean that everywhere we get a refrednce we check for its type  
12:30 <vmassol> we're supposed to know our inputs  
12:31 <vmassol> I'm just saying that it would be nice to explain why this code deosn't always get doc refernces  
12:31 <vmassol> (remember I don't know this code at all)  
12:31 <vmassol> (gdelhumeau)  
12:32 <vmassol> Maybe it would suffice to document that the code  
12:32 <vmassol> adds a link for log content that points to document references  
12:32 <vmassol> ?  
12:32 <vmassol> (if I uderstand correctly)  
12:37 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/pull/215  
12:38 <vmassol> still not 100% correct: "## We will display a link to that entity, so we need to extract the document from it."  
12:39 <vmassol> hmm  
12:39 <vmassol> I still don't get it  
12:39 <vmassol> what was the error?  
12:40 <vmassol> (gdelhumeau)  
12:40 <gdelhumeau> we did a getURL() to an entity which was an object  
12:40 <vmassol> so we're prtining object references in the log?  
12:41 <gdelhumeau> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9729  
12:41 <vmassol> log=ERROR:Collision found on object [Object workspace:XWiki.XWikiAllGroup^workspace:XWiki.XWikiGroups[1]]  
12:41 <vmassol> what do you want to generate for this?  
12:42 <vmassol> BTW maybe getURL should be fixed  
12:42 <vmassol> instead

15:25 <vmassol> sburjan: back  
15:26 <sburjan> vmassol: just a question out of curiosity  
15:27 <sburjan> I am in a XE wish 3 subwikis. I visit a subwiki, doesn't matter which one of them. in the URL, instead of wiki name, I put another name which does not exist. I get the content from the main wiki, but the URL stays the same. is this intended ?  
15:30 <vmassol> yes  
15:30 <vmassol> we don't do any redirect  
15:30 <vmassol> we just fallback to the main wiki  
15:30 <vmassol> (by default)  
15:33 <tmortagne> sburjan: the whole point is to be sure you will access the main wiki if the URL does not match anything, if we do a redirect and the main wiki descriptor is wrong or does not exist (which is the default) we have no idea what URL to redirect to  
15:34 <sburjan> understood. thanks  
15:43 <tmortagne> camil7: you tested https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/pull/212/files ? I'm surprise + syntax work in #set actually but maybe it's working since 1.7 and I'm too used to the old version  
15:45 <tmortagne> that's my only comment, IMO it's acceptable so if you confirm me it's working for sure I'm going to apply it  
15:46 <tmortagne> nvm I tested it myself and it indeed works  
15:48 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: you need a committer to close XWIKI-9729 or is there something else to do ?  
15:49 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: I just pushed a PR concerning your last advice on github  
15:50 <tmortagne> ok, looking  
15:50 <tmortagne> applied  
15:51 <gdelhumeau> thx  
15:51 <gdelhumeau> So I think I can close the jira now  
15:54 <camil7> tmortagne: yes, I tested it locally - did not run any integrtion tests or the like  
15:55 <tmortagne> camil7: ok  
15:55 <camil7> (sorry, been abducted by aliens for the usual experiments, but back now)  
15:56 <camil7> thanks for applying the patch!  
15:57 <tmortagne> camil7: that's to you for the patch ;)  
15:58 <tmortagne> \*thanks

16:45 <Kaisen> Hello, I have just a short question. Is there a possibilit to split up a standard page like if I have a Dashboard on it and say add column  
16:47 <vmassol> Kaisen: use the container macro, see extensions.xwiki.org  
16:47 <vmassol> !search Container Macro  
16:47 <vmassol> too bad, I tried ;)  
16:49 <Kaisen> Thanks !

18:08 <gdelhumeau> guys, do you think we should fix http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9495 for 5.2.2?  
18:08 <mflorea> has quit  
18:10 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: I thought this was fixed in 5.3 already?  
18:10 <vmassol> (the issue is still open)  
18:11 <vmassol> regarding 5.2.2, it depends what is involved and wether there's any risk of a regression which we cannot have in 5.2.2  
18:12 <msmeria> has quit  
18:13 <cjd> has quit  
18:14 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: in 5.3, the page does not exist  at all  
18:15 <gdelhumeau> so I want to fix as "won't fix"  
18:15 <gdelhumeau> but you may want to rename WorkspaceManager.Install to XWiki.InstallWorkspaces in 5.2.2  
18:22 <vmassol> it looks more like a duplicate for 5.3  
18:22 <vmassol> well maybe not, I understand what you mean now  
18:22 <tmortagne> what this page was doing is useless now  
18:23 <vmassol> tmortagne: it's the other way around  
18:23 <vmassol> we wanted to fix this issue and as a consequence we removed the need for it  
18:23 <vmassol> but anyway  
18:23 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: what would the rename do for 5.2.2?  
18:23 <tmortagne> so what this page was doing is useless now...  
18:23 <vmassol> no  
18:23 <tmortagne> IMO this issue is a won't fix  
18:23 <vmassol> we still need a template  
18:24 <vmassol> it's still useful  
18:24 <gdelhumeau> no  
18:24 <tmortagne> vmassol: it's not required anymore  
18:24 <gdelhumeau> the template creation is optionnal  
18:27 <tmortagne> there is no need to fix an improvement for a stable branch

18:29 <vmassol> what I don't understand yet is what we could do for 5.2.2.  
18:39 <vmassol> guys, I'm going to restart xwiki.org. I need to patch it to try to fix http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9734
